result.execSummary:
The defendant Erik T. Baldwin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Erik T. Baldwin is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Erik T. Baldwin was found guilty of Retail Theft - Alter Price (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:  Attend, pay for, and successfully complete treatment or educational programming ordered by the agent.  Submit DNA sample at the Richland County Sheriff's Department.  No court costs ordered as those costs have been remitted by the Court in this case.

JOC AMENDED 4-21-17 in response to Court's review following DOC's request for probation length clarification. Court amends the sentence to reflect the correct term of probation: 1 year.

JOC AMENDED 4-21-17 to clarify that Count 2 is consecutive to 12CF116.
Consecutive to: 12CF116

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erik T. Baldwin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter from DOC requesting clarification on Judgment of Conviction for Count 1

Clerk attempted to phone DOC - left message for Agent Hylkema who, in letter received by the clerk 8/23/17, requests clerk to delete verbage from 4/21/17 amended JOC stating that the Court clarified Count 2 is consecutive to 12CF116. Clerk notes this language was added to the JOC intentionally and by order of the Court - Judge Andrew Sharp. Judge Sharp directed the clerk to amend the JOC in this matter on 4/21 in response to a DOC letter to him at that time. Clerk will not delete this language as it was ordered this way by the Judge. If DOC has further questions, the agent needs to contact Judge Sharp.
Letter from DOC inquiring about Amended JOC
Per DOC request, Court orders amendment of JOC to clarify that Count 2 is consecutive to 12CF116
to Ms. Nehring from judge re amendment of the JOC
Drug Court Order
Letter from DOC requesting clarification on JOC

Defendant Erik T. Baldwin in court, in custody of the LaCrosse County Jail (treatment ATR) with attorney Timothy Luke Angel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 15CF35 and 15CM70 called together. Counsel inform the Court of the parties' agreement for resolution, calling for pleas to count 1 in 15CF35 and count 1 in 15CM70.

15CF35 - def waives right to prelim. Court's colloquy re prelim waiver. Def pleads guilty.

15CF70 - def pleads guilty to count 1.

Court's colloquy re pleas. Finding of guilty.

Sentence:  withheld for total of 4 years probation (4 years on 15CF35 and 2 years on 15CM70, concurrent).  Conditions:  attend, pay for, and successfully complete treatment or educational programming ordered by the agent; submit DNA sample at jail; 1 set of costs (felony); costs remitted in CM case; costs a condition of probation.  1 day credit in the event of revocation; to be applied to 15CF35.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 21, 2016 at 11:00 am.

15CF35 and 15CM70/set for plea hearing today.  Attorney Timothy Luke Angel in court for Defendant Erik T. Baldwin. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Erik T. Baldwin not in court.  DA states the def is in custody in LaCrosse County; asks for reset.  Atty. A states that the def is presently in programming, about half way through.  Adj. to 9/21 at 11.  Atty. A asks that be set as plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Plea hearing on August 31, 2016 at 09:00 am.
